I originally wrote my review when I was a cringe child, so I'm now going to re-write my review as a slightly less cringe adult.

SMITE is a pretty damn good MOBA.

It has a very high production value with its skins, its maps, and items. None of its visuals are bad. There's a significant amount of player choice when it comes to what you want equipped, from your music to your skin, to your loading frames and announcer. 

The god balance is...alright. New gods are always power crept, and take a patch or two to mellow out. But overall I feel most of the roster is viable if you know how to play them.

The community is a little more toxic than I'd like, people will often take it WAAAAYYY too seriously. Assault (the all random mode where you cannot pick your character) has a significant amount of people that will flame you for not knowing how to play a god you've never seen before, but you can just mute them. 

Overall I'd give the game about a 8/10, score can dip up or down a point given the patch. But it has King Arthur so it can't' go below a 7.

Smite has been one of those games that i have been using to fill my addiction gap. Spent waaaay too many hours playing it and i think i have a pretty good understanding of the game and how i feel about it so knowing this i shall now go and list everything in the pros and cons of the game. Tl;dr at the bottom (he he he bottom)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PROS:
-The game itself: Mobas have a very strict formula. Top down, 3 lanes and 2 jungles. BUT WHAT IF WE SHIFTED THE CAMERA BEHIND THE ACTUAL PLAYABLE CHARACTERS? It might sound stupid but it makes the game soo much more fun. Theres something here for everybody.

-Always a mode ready to go: Smite has 6 maps + a daily changed "Mode of the day" The maps and their game modes are: 
Joust - 3v3 map with a single lane some jungle camps and a miniboss thats actualy easier too beat then the camps.
Arena - 5v5 map with no lane just a big fucking circle that you punch eachother in the face in until your tickets get sold out.
Conquest - The most basic 5v5 match there is.(cant thing of anything to add here)
Clash - Like joust but with 2 lanes and 5v5.
Assault - 1 lane, 5v5, no base healing, no backing, no buying items unless you die. Win only by killing the enemy team until they come back with every item in the game and destroy your ass.
Siege - SIEGE MAINS WHERE YOU AT?! like clash but 4v4. Most underplayed game mode out there.
MOTD-s - Not gonna write every single one fuck even i dont remember all of them and i have no life!

-The best community out there: A major factor in any online game is the people who play it. Usualy its never good but smite has some of the best, most helpful people i have met in an online game.

-The VGS system: Voice communication in videogames has always only been 2 things: Horrible and "your mom" jokes. Now imagine instead of voice communication you have a set of commands that YELL AT YOU AND MAKE YOUR MOM JOKES.

-The fact that you are literaly playing gods: Makes you live your fantasy of being the prettiest girl out there.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

CONS: 
-The stability and servers: Oh boy my favorite part here goes. The game runs like shit if you dont meet the recommended requirements and/or have it installed on an ssd. Some freezes here and there, crashes and the servers my god the servers. They havent changed in 4 years. Do they hinder the game itself? Yes and no, sometimes just a random freeze can really ruin your play and make you regret living in the first place.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

At this point in time i have 799 hours logged. I'm gonna do a short and sweet review of the game and try and list a few things that are diffrent than other MOBA'S and hopefully give you guys some insight for people looking to get into the game. 

Smite is a 3rd person MOBA unlike most MOBA's, which are usually top down, now with that being said makes the game imo a whole diffrent type of MOBA and the way i prefer to play a MOBA.

I've only played around 3 matches of LoL, and as ive said before i prefer the 3rd person aspect, top down games just arent my style, so i cant really compare this to other MOBA's

Now. to get to the basics, you have your Guardians,Mages,Warriors,Hunters and Assassins, All of which are all fun to play my preffered class would usually be a guardian or mage seeing that not many people choose to play guardians and that hunters are far to generic.

Hunters- Hunters are your standard point and hold left click for the most part they are effective early game but most useful in late game scenarios to shut down the lower health gods easily and also beat down your enamy Tank.

Mages- All around good class used to shut down most all god types most having a very diffrent kit and reasonably diffrent from each other enough to realize you're playing another god and not a re-skin of another.

Guardians- Guardians are your preferred tank class although warriors can also be very tanky most guardians are fun in their own way and all have a play in the game but less than the other classes imo unless the right hands are behind them.

Warriors- Warriors are very fun to play alot of them have good kits and some of them being very overpowered in the right hands and some being huge game changers for your 5v5 fights in late game joust.

Assassins- Assassins are very crucial to your Conquest matches (5v5) and quite a few of them are left untouched during seasons due to a few being Overpowered, They're used for your jungling and to gank lane as most moba's.

Now that thats over with i'd like to touch base on a few of the things i like and dont like about smite.

Pro's- Visually the game looks great every one of the gods are very detailed, maps look great and the spells and abilities really bring all of it to life during matches.

3rd person aspect- as ive said before i dont enjoy top down games and if you do thats fine you may still like smite regardless, Top down just isnt my cup of tea.

Community- All in all the community is great in a whole if you join in solo for the most part if there are people playing solo as well they are usually nice, although you can have teams of clan people who are toxic just as there would be toxic people in other Moba's but smite seems to have less toxicity than other Moba's too me.

Updates-Smite is regularly updated with new content Very Often, in the last year It's seen around 11 new gods meaning we see new gods almost every month, Gods usually stay relatively balanced with your select few that are more overpowered than others, but High-Rez stays on top of it.

Gods-All of the gods feel diffrent to me very few of them have simialar skills and for the most part all of the gods in the game are fun and ANY of them can be good if they are in the right hands.

Cons-Unfortunately there are some bad things about smite and i will tell you what my biggest problems with the game are.

Hunters- Hunters are fun to play and i wont lie i love to play Neith,Ah Muzen Cab, Xblanque and many others, BUT they need to be nerfed unlike League (going by word of mouth) Yes, their abilities help them in fights tremendously but some if not all of them by end game only have to hold down left click to kill anybody, doesnt matter what their opponent is even guardians get melted with full physical protection, I'd suggest removing penetration items from the game, They make being a guardian not fun.

Guardians- There are alot of fun guardians in the game BUT, as ive said in the previous statement Hunters can melt them, just as any other class can in the right hands, they just dont feel tanky enough most of the time no matter how much armor you build, and even at this point you can build for damage so you do no damage and die regardless due to the lack of damage resistance from said armor. Although there are many guardians that do alot of damage and are seemingly tankier than others leaving the other guardians hanging out to dry.

Now that ive gotten my two biggest gripes over classes out of the way ill list a few diffrent other urks i have with the game.

I've previously stated that there isnt alot of toxicity in the game but, I like to play assault alot and i've done this before just in case someone reading this recognizes my name, Being toxic or talking crap in this game-mode makes you look like a huge dbag, You're not playing Ranked-Conquest. Stop acting like it, Thats my only problem with the community is that i can understand when someone is purposely throwing the match/feeding but, if you watch and see that they're actually trying, give them a chance if you lose at the end of the match say gg, nice try they may be new and your actions could be the reason that they stop playing the game, meaning we're losing people from an amazing game that already has a much smaller player base than the likes of Dota 2, or LoL.

Last thing is the server downtime, I want this game to grow, and i want the playerbase to grow also, But, it seems like and moreso here recently that the servers have been down quite a bit. in The last month there was upwards of a week (altogether) that i couldnt play because of server downtime. I've read many articles stating that it's Because of DDOS from other developers, I would hope that another company wouldnt stoop that low. My problem with all of this is not that im missing out on playing but afraid that at some point people will get tired of it and go to something else, and im sure im not the only person that feels this way. So High-Rez you've made one of my favorite games of all time, Please, try and fix this problem.

Thats the end of all of my pro's/con's and gripes of the game Hopefully this will help you to decide to play or not to play and it answered some questions for you.

This is a very fun M.O.B.A. genre game with a cast of recognizable gods from respective religious pantheons. Smite has a simillar layout to the game Leauge of legends in that it's main gamemode is a three lane layout leading to the other teams base. All the lanes play a role in team composition and are chosen when you select the roles as follows

1. Jungler, (this is primarily and assassin god) Junglers main focus are the buff camps that spawn in the space between lanes and infiltrating (Ganking) the back line to eliminate the squishier gods (squishy=low hp, defense) *keep note that as of season four any god is playable in any role*

2. Middle lane/ Mid. (this is primarilly a mage god. As a Mid. laner your objective is to take down the towers, pheonix and titan all accessable by the middle lane. After you build the proper items for your playstyle you will most often become your teams backiline using high damage abilities to take out the opposing teams frontline (try and avoid the enemy jungler as they will most likey build to counter you) *keep note that as of season four any god is playable in any role*

3. Attack. Damage. Carry./ ADC (this is most often the hunter class of gods. As the carry you will be placed in the longer of the two lanes ( the side switches depending on if you are on the order team or chaos team ) you will most often be assisted by the teams support. Your high damage basic attacks keep you in the frontline as the teams main damage source but it makes you an easy target in teamfights so always be aware of your posistion while engaging a fight. 

4. Solo lane/ solo ( most often the warrior class of god) as the solo lane you will head to the smaller lane on the left or right ( the side switches depending on if you are on the order team or chaos team ) this is the lane that the jungler will assist most often when clearing buff camps. Most of the time spent here will be a one VS. one with the enemy solo laner. Late game ( after the average god level is around 15+ you should rotate to other lanes and assist as a secondary support becoming a frontliner for your team. 

5. Support ( this is most often the guardian class of god ) you are your teams imovable sheild keep them alive at the cost of your own and let your team get the kills. (a good support can bring almost any team to victory ) you will move around to lanes that need help or you will follow the enemy support.

*Keep in note these tips are for the Conquest gamemode for smite not the other avalible options*

Hi rez kinda suck at balancing games, I get its difficult but their style is to make something and then nerf it into the ground. The recently released roman goddess Terra is a good example, Terra is only useful in competitive team games because playing her properly requires a lot of team coordination, if you don't have that team then terra is a waste of a player. They nerfed her 4 times since she was released and didnt touch what made her worth getting in competitive, only made everything else worse, all they needed to do was reduce the amount of cooldown and mana refund her ult offered the team, that was it and she was balanced but they took literally everything else and drove it into the ground. Now she cant do any damage, her crowd control isnt that good (yeah there is a root and a stun but they are too short for anything other than pro teams to make use of), her heal isnt potent enough and lasts too long as well as scaling poorly with power, the monolith that causes the heal can be destroyed far too easily.

Matchmaking, its not the worst system in the world but it really punishes playing alone as you can get put in situations where its 5 solo guys Vs a clan which is more or less a gauranteed loss if the clan are even remotely capable of playing as a team. The game balances based on your win-loss ratio or something with special consideration for kills, this system favours assasins and kill stealing more than playing the game well, it can also force you into teams where the other players are way better than you and you become the weak link in a chain and teams where you are the only good player and cannot drag your team to the win and theres nothing worse than being stuck in one of those situations where you are way out of your league because despite the average skill level of each team being the same one guy on one team is responsible for most of the skill (or lack thereof).

The community, its a free to play game where you can chat via keyboard. This always results in an insufferable community that will do ridiculous things like send death threats for not following the pro leagues meta in a casual game, it doesnt matter if the meta is right or not or even how well you perform, you will still get called a peice of shit for it, theres no real consequence for quitting out mid game and because of this people will quit for being beat ONCE, ONCE FFS these people cannot handle being beat despite it being a part of the game. People will also shit on you for choosing items that they arent familiar with, actively discrouraging creative thinking and counter building. You can even get shit on for being focussed, a good strategy for handling high skill players is focussing them and forcing them to be useless early on and if that happens to you your team are MORE LIKELY to call you shit than to take a second to realise the other team are throwing everything they have at you and not eveyone else. They won't adapt to the situation or take advantage of the fact the other team blew their load on you or anything useful they will just bitch and often times quit, and then theres instalocking, you get people who actively refuse to play with the team in a team game, 1 isnt too bad but you get 2-4 instalocking players and its a recipe for disaster, they will also blame you for their failures despite them being the ones doing nothing for the team and they throw games because of these fucking hissy fits. The community also has trouble adapting to changing situations and many players are quite predictable, if you can adapt to how others play and spot the patterns its easy to do shit like approximate where players with invisibility abilities will go while cloaked (I am very good at that and its always hilarious owning some guy who thinks no one knows where they are), its easy to tell who will become the assasins number one target and its easy to tell when the other team will make a move to try and surprise you.

It's inpenetrable to new players, between the poor balancing, constant tweaking, high skill ceiling and awful community its pretty hard to get into the game and enjoy yourself.

In summary I more or less just went off at how fucking awful the issues this game has can get. It's worth playing if you can get some mates together and form a clan but if not skip it entirely.

Really at first a nice game, especially nice were some of the gods costumes you could get for gods like Bastet, Arachne, Medusa, and others. The overall game play was nice even for someone not interested in MOBA and/or PVP in general. But that is about as far as it goes with saying positive things about this game.

No game out there has a balanced setup of characters, but this game has some characters so balanced that they are really ineffective unless you make custom builds for them. However, the recommended items for this are never listed on the inventory buying area for the character you have to do all items, in order to find the effective ones...

Oh, and don't think you can do your weekly quests or even event quests by doing Co-Op vs AI game play like a friend of mine on there thought. It don't work that way... The Hi-Rez people make sure you have to play Normal mode to be able to clear those quests... :( One other reason I don't recommend it. 

The community is as toxic as it gets, especially when you either play with or encounter "Ranked" players and the group is getting had by other "Ranked" players... And in many cases those "Ranked" players will see either a starter god (one of the 5 like Neith) or a "balanced" god like Medusa and/or Freya and single them out even if they are grouped tight with their group trying to protect them. What rubish that is when as a game it supposed to be fun and a nice time waster.

And there is the other issue, it is none of these really. You spend a lot of gems on things like costumes for the gods or limited edition costumes... You spend time trying to get Favor for other items, maybe you even brought a few boosters too for all that. In the end, its really not helpful for anything. Boosters may help you get to Level 30 player level fast and get Favor fast, but thats all... Good Will does nothing but add at the most 10 favor to your reward, so leaving a match before time isn't hurtful at all to the player other than a lock out that scales from 30 mins, 60 mins, 2 hours, to 4 hours in duration.

The game really isn't that interesting to play beyond an hour here and there... No storyline, no cool graphics, no upgrading gods to be better unlike League of Legends, no supportive community, no real anything... It is just a CS:GO without the FPS shooter aspect, and you play as a third person character with limited MMORPG like abilities that fall within the MMORPG trinity... :( 

I don't recommend this game, because it leaves a lot to be desired. I do recommend it to the few that  enjoy MOBAs and CSGO game playstyles. But as a MMORPG'er and MOBA player, I wouldn't really recommend this to anyone except for a quick battle here and there.
